reviewText: If you have never been a fan of bluegrass, but love gospel music, you will learn to appreciate quality bluegrass.  Bill Gaither has gathered Homecoming Friends and some great bluegrass performers for this TWO part Homecoming Concerts that is a departure from the usual.What makes this so special is the blending of country artists, bluegrass, and good old gospel music in a live setting with notable entertainers, Ralph Stanley, Marty Stuart, Ricky Skaggs, Nitty Gritty Dirt Band, and Marty Raybon.  You might recognize Marty from the country group Shenandoah. And, there are more, The Isaacs, The Easters, Rhonda Vincent, Del McCoury, Doyle Lawson, and the Lewis Family and the Gaither Vocal Band singing that beautiful song "Yes I Know".You will see a great instrumental of pure bluegrass pickin with several of the performers.  And for the Bonus Feature, Marty Stuart goes back to the original home of AP Carter and sings with family members.The music is listed as:  This Little Light Of Mine (Marty Stuart And His Fabulous Superlatives);  Just Over in Heaven and We Shall Inherit (Doyle Lawson & Quicksilver); The Gospel Plow (The Nashville Bluegrass Band)Lee Highway Blues (Stuart Duncan, Marty Stuart); Yes, I Know (Gaither Vocal Band);  A Robin Built A Nest On Daddy's Grave and Gloryland  (Ralph Stanley & Clinch Mountain Boys);When The Angels Sing and You Don't Love God If You Don't Love Your Neighbor (Rhonda Vincent And The Rage)Swing Low, Sweet Chariot (The Easters)  Halfway Home Cafe (Ricky Skaggs & Kentucky Thunder)Bluegrass Breakdown (Ricky Skaggs, Marty Stuart, Del McCoury)Is Not This The Land Of Beulah (The Isaacs) Get Up In Jesus' Name (Marty Raybon)So Many Years, So Many Blessings and Honey in the Rock (The Lewis Family);  I Believe and Get Down On Your knees and Pray (Del McCoury)  Sunday Meetin' Time (Jake Hess)I Find Jesus and Will The Circle Be Unbroken (The Nitty Gritty Dirt Band)This is a great concert!!  Try the companion DVDGospel Bluegrass Homecoming, Vol. 2..... Rizzo
summary: Truly... a great concert with superb bluegrass musicians!

reviewText: Love this DVD. All performers were at their best. Although there were a couple of songs that really couldn't be called "gospel", they melded well with the others that were. This is one to treasure through the years.

reviewText: We love this group singing their Gospel Bluegrass.  It is a big favorite of ours.  We have enjoyed these singers for a lot of years, and will continue listening as long as they continue playing and singing.  Such a blessing!

reviewText: Well! I finally found my song.  This DVD was my fourth purchase, (-after Nashville, Texas and Guy), just trying to fine YES I KNOW.) In case anyone wants to know, this is it! Just be sure you buy GOSPEL Bluegrass Homecoming. Yeah, I almost goofed again, but caught it just in time.Maybe I do not fully understand what Bue Grass is, because some of this seems like Hill Billy, and some seems a bit like jazz (which I like most of the time), and I never thought of YES I KNOW as being Blue Grass.  With these thoughts in mind, I feel underqualified to do a proper review of this DVD. So, let me report just my own personal whatever: I will say it is okay, eehhhh.  I am sorry. Yes, I knew I was taking a chance but I did want YES I KNOW, and I have it now. Uh huh, and now I also have: "IF YOU DON'T LOVE GOD, YOU DON'T LOVE YOUR NEIGHBOR! Oh, she was a good performer, I think. She seemed like such a nice lady, not one that would make faces or anything like that. She must have other songs that she likes better.Sure glad I finally found that beautiful song by the GVB. So pretty.Mickey Thorne
